sub_title: Mechatronics Engineer and Researcher changing the world one nanometer at a time @ASML
summary:
My experience is mostly in R&D. I have worked on a variety of projects closely connected to industry and academia. I have strong skills in software and hardware development specially applied to simulations and data acquisition in different platforms (e.g. Matlab, Simulink, Labview, C++) as well as in designing and building experimental setups for all types of tests that include automatic control and online data acquisition. I also have experience in processing silicon wafers for manufacturing MEMS devices in cleanroom environments and developing test platforms to validate this type of components.

I really like to work on things closing the link between science and industry developing high-tech products that can help improving people’s lives.

For me, the perfect working environment allows and encourages people to be free and seek personal development and growth. I believe that this is what makes people happy and realized with their jobs and allows them to explore their potential and creativity while helping the company and their group to grow and develop in a sustainable way.

profile_positions.description: Mechatronics Engineer and Researcher working as Design Engineer for ASML.
profile_positions.title: Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: In my PhD I worked on the development of water MEMS thrusters for spacecraft applications. This project required a lot of experimental work to manufacture and test the devices in cleanroom environments. After manufacturing and a long test and characterization campaign, I collected enough data to help in the development of dynamic models that fully represent the behavior of the system. The models I developed were then used to create an intelligent fuzzy approach to deal with problem of controlling multiple redundant devices.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

company.name: CNPq - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.company: CNPq - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
profile_positions.description: This project was a continuation of my MSc work in which I worked developing embedded software for attitude control systems of spacecraft. A testbed equipped with three reaction wheels, a 9-dof IMU, and an on-board computer was used to develop and test the control algorithms. I also built a simulation scenario connecting STK, MATLAB and the on-board computer to allow the simulation of missions that require precise attitude control.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.company: CNPq - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
profile_positions.description: In this project I worked on software development for simulation of aircraft missions. I developed an add-on to the project OpenEaagles to integrate Lua scripting and allow the easy and quick implementation of autonomous pilots. I also added the modules to integrate SOAR and CLIPS into the software framework.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description: This project was part of my MSc work in which I worked developing embedded software for attitude control systems of spacecraft. A testbed equipped with three reaction wheels, a 9-dof IMU, and an on-board computer was used to develop and test the control algorithms. I also built a simulation scenario connecting STK, MATLAB and the on-board computer to allow the simulation of missions that require precise attitude control.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description: During this period I worked in two projects: ITASAT - a student satellite and IMA4BRAZIL - a software platform for satellite on-board computing. In my thesis I developed a framework for the development of software for attitude control of small satellites.
profile_positions.title: MSc Student

profile_positions.description: Scientific initiation program in two projects: "Biogeography-based optimization for electric power systems" and "Multi-objective approaches of Scatter Search, Artificial Bee Colony, and Simultaneous Perturbation Stochastic Approximation applied to the optimization of economic dispatch in electric power systems".
profile_positions.title: Scholarship Holder
